method.name: IsMatch
method.summary: Indicates whether the regex matches the given subject.

method.name: Match
method.summary: Matches the regex against the given subject.

method.name: Matches
method.summary: Returns an enumerable of all matches found in the given subject.

param.param: The subject string to be matched.

remarks.para: Note that using a static matching method is not efficient. For best performance, create a object and use its instance methods.

param.param: The index at which the match should be attempted.

remarks.para:
Passing a non-zero
differs from passing a shortened string if the pattern starts with an assertion (such as \b) or contains lookbehinds.

param.param: Additional options to apply for the match.
A function to be called when a callout point is reached during the match.

remarks.para: Within a regular expression, (?C<arg>) indicates a point at which the external function is to be called. Different callout points can be identified by putting a number less than 256 after the letter C. The default value is zero. Alternatively, the argument may be a delimited string. The starting delimiter must be one of ` ' " ^ % # $ { and the ending delimiter is the same as the start, except for {, where the ending delimiter is }. If the option bit is set when a pattern is compiled, PCRE2 automatically inserts callouts, all with number 255, before each item in the pattern except for immediately before or after an explicit callout.
